abstracts.cdata!:
The project is part of multi-sectoral
            program to fight HIV/AIDS in Mozambique, and reduce the
            prevalence of the epidemic. In this frame, the environmental
            assessment (EA) focuses heavily on the handling, collection,
            evacuation, and management of wastes resulting from the
            incidence of HIV/AIDS. The EA sets the framework to regulate
            the health care waste (HCW) management in health facilities,
            and procedures to control, through a technical approach, HCW
            management, beginning with an emphasis on information
            campaigns, and training programs, followed by the
            reinforcement of the management capacity of the private
            sector involved in solid waste management, which includes a
            framework for partnerships with civil society. Equipment for
            adequate HCWs collection, storage containers, and
            incinerators will be provided for health care facilities,
            and, appropriate uses of recyclable materials will be promoted.
